Clinical Notes

Patient presents with persistent ear pain in the right ear for the past 5 days. Reports mild hearing loss and occasional tinnitus. No fever or discharge observed. Previous history of recurrent otitis media in childhood. Physical examination shows mild erythema of the tympanic membrane with no perforation visible. Recommended audiometry and possible CT scan if symptoms persist.

How to Use LocalClinic AI

üöÄ Quick Start

  1. Wait for AI to load - Look for the green "AI Model Ready" indicator at the top
  2. Choose your input method - Use one of the tabs below
  3. Select analysis type - Choose from Diagnosis Aid, Summary, Key Findings, or Recommendations
  4. Click Analyze - View AI-assisted findings on the right panel

üìã Input Methods

Patient Content Paste or type clinical notes directly into the text area
Upload Upload images (X-rays, photos), videos, or PDF documents
Capture Screen Capture content from another window or tab (e.g., your EMR)
Analyze Visible Content Analyze currently displayed content in the viewer
External Content (URL) Load content from a URL (e.g., online medical records)

üéØ Analysis Types

Diagnosis Aid Get AI suggestions for possible diagnoses based on the content
Summary Get a concise summary of the clinical content
Key Findings Extract and highlight important medical findings
Recommendations Get suggested next steps or treatment considerations

üìù Generating Reports

  1. After analysis, your findings appear in the Report Draft panel on the right
  2. Set the Examination Date
  3. Add your own Doctor's Notes
  4. Enter a Final Diagnosis
  5. Click Generate Report to create a formatted report
  6. Use Export to save as PDF, Word, or copy to clipboard

üîí Privacy & Security

100% Local Processing - All AI runs in your browser

No Data Sent - Patient data never leaves your computer

HIPAA-Friendly - Designed with healthcare privacy in mind

Works Offline - After first load, works without internet

‚ö†Ô∏è Important Reminder

This tool is meant to assist, not replace, your clinical judgment.

Always verify AI-generated findings against your professional expertise and established medical guidelines.

üÜò Need Help?
